snippet: The head of France’s National Front party refused on Tuesday to endorse either remaining candidate, and instead urged her supporters to “vote according to your conscience.”
abstract: Marine Le Pen, leader of France's far-right National Front party, refuses to endorse either Nicolas Sarkozy or Francois Hollande in the country's contentious runoff election; National Front garnered about 18 percent of the electorate in the first round of the election, and their 6.4 million votes could prove decisive in the runoff.

byline.contributor: Eleanor Stanford, Meghan Davidson and Roswana Khan contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The head of France’s National Front party refused on Tuesday to endorse either remaining candidate, and instead urged her supporters to “vote according to your conscience.”

headline.seo: Le Pen, National Front Leader, Refuses to Endorse in French Runoff
headline.main: French Far-Right Leader Endorses No One in Runoff
headline.print_headline: French Far-Right Leader Endorses No One in Runoff
